loginterval.helper: Frequency of Cumulus log entries - set your station to the same

helpers: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.
THESE OVERIDES ARE ONLY VALID AFTER THE UNITS CONFIGURATION ABOVE HAS BEEN SET, SAVED AND THIS PAGE RELOADED

tempdp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

pressdp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

raindp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

winddp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

windavgdp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

windrundp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

airqulaitydp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

sunshinedp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

uvdp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

units.helper: DO NOT change units after you have chosen them for the first time!

sitename.helper: A short name for the location

description.helper: A longer description of the location

hemisphere.helper: Is the station North or South of the equator?
Is the station East or West of the Prime Meridian (Greenwich)?

comportname.helper: Your station serial port (real or virtual)

disconperiod.helper: Period to disconnect once a minute from IP loggers to allow them to upload to WeatherLink.com. Time in seconds

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

syncstationclock.helper: Keep station clock in line with computer clock (Davis/Instromet only)

syncclockhour.helper: The hour of the day to synchronise the station clock (Davis/Instromet only)

readreceptionstats.helper: Read Davis reception stats to provide values for corresponding web tags

setloggerinterval.rightLabel: Set the Davis Logger interval to match Cumulus MX interval
helpers: WARNING: This will clear all data from your logger if it is invoked.
If the Davis logger interval does not match the Cumulus interval, set it to match.
Requires a restart of Cumulus MX

useloop2.rightLabel: Enable use of the LOOP2 data packets (UseDavisLoop2)
useloop2.helper: This should only be disabled on VP consoles or VP2 consoles using firmware versions before version 1.90

raingaugetype.helper: Default is auto, the size is inferred from the units selected for the station

helpers: Force older Vantage Pro and Pro2 barometer to update once a minute instead of the default 15 minutes
This is not required for the majority of stations in use today
Time to wait after establishing a connection to an IP logger before sending commands
Time is in milliseconds
Time to wait after sending a command to an IP logger before trying to read the response
Time is in milliseconds

tcpport.helper: TCP/IP port for your logger. Default is 22222

autoDiscover.helper: Enable auto-discovery of your WLL devices IP address - do not enable if you have more than one device

apiStationId.helper: Enter the station id used for your WLL device in the WeatherLink.com APIv2, OR if you do not know this, leave this field blank and Cumulus will attempt to discover it for you

wind.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Wind sensor

temphum.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Temperature/Humidity sensor

rain.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Rain sensor

solar.helper: Optional: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Solar sensor

uv.helper: Optional: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your UV sensor

soilTempTx1.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #1

soilTempIdx1.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #1

soilTempTx2.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #2

soilTtempIdx2.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #2

soilTempTx3.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #3

soilTempIdx3.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #3

soilTempTx4.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #4

soilTempIdx4.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #4

soilMoistTx1.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra soil moisture sensor #1

soilMoistIdx1.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your extra soil moisture sensor #1

soilMoistTx2.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra soil moisture sensor #2

soilMoistIdx2.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your soil moisture leaf sensor #2

soilMoistTx3.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra soil moisture sensor #3

soilMoistIdx3.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your soil moisture leaf sensor #3

soilMoistTx4.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your soil moisture leaf sensor #4

soilMoistIdx4.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your extra soil moisture sensor #4

leafTx1.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra leaf sensor #1

leafIdx1.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your extra leaf sensor #1

leafTx2.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra leaf sensor #2

leafIdx2.helper: Optional: Select the index within the transmitter ID for your extra leaf sensor #2

extraTempTx1.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #1

extraHumTx1.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx2.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #2

extraHumTx2.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx3.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #3

extraHumTx3.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx4.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #4

extraHumTx4.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx5.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #5

extraHumTx5.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx6.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #6

extraHumTx6.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx7.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #7

extraHumTx7.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx8.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #8

extraHumTx8.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

helpers: Default is auto, the size will be set when Cumulus connects to your WLL
* Denotes normal Davis tipper sizes
The UDP multicast port used by the WLL, this will normally be discovered from the WLL

autoDiscover.helper: Enable auto-discovery of your GW1000 devices IP address

helpers: Populated by Cumulus when using auto-discovery.
Do not edit unless you change your GW1000 device for a new one, then just delete this entry and the new MAC address will be added for you by auto-discovery.

syncreads.helper: Attempts to synchronise console reads to avoid clashing with the console writing the data

helpers: The time span around the synchronised read to avoid reading from the console.
The default 3 seconds means do not read from  3 secs before to 3 secs after the expected write time.
Time in seconds

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

helpers: Delay after requesting a memory read before trying to read data from the USB connection
Time in milli-seconds
Specify an non-standard VID. Use -1 to use the normal setting
Specify an non-standard PID. Use -1 to use the normal setting
How often to read the EasyWeather data file in minutes
Path and filename of the EasyWeather data file (Easyweather.dat or EasyWeatherPlus.dat)
Pressure value below which Cumulus will ignore the value in the file. Value in hPa/mbar
Pressure value above which Cumulus will ignore the value in the file. Value in hPa/mbar
Number of rain bucket tips between data reads above which Cumulus will ignore the increase
Offset value to apply to the pressure value in EasyWeather data file

comportname.helper: Only required if your station is connected via a serial port (real or virtual)

baudrate.helper: Serial port baud rate in bps

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

syncstationclock.helper: Keep station clock in line with computer clock (Davis/Instromet only)

syncclockhour.helper: The hour of the day to synchronsie the station clock (Davis/Instromet only)

updatepointer.helper: Update the memory pointer to the last record after every 30 data reads

helpers: Delay after sending a command before trying to read data from the serial port
Time in milli-seconds
Delay between sending data read commands
Time in milli-seconds

usezerobearing.helper: Use zero for current bearing if speed is zero

calcwindaverage.helper: Use Cumulus value instead of station

usespeedforavg.helper: Use station 'speed' in calculation instead of 'latest' as latter may be a gust figure

use100for98hum.helper: For stations which don't go above 98%

calculatedewpoint.helper: Use Cumulus value instead of station

calculatewindchill.helper: Use Cumulus value instead of station

cumuluspresstrendnames.helper: Use Cumulus names for pressure trends instead of station

roundwindspeeds.helper: Round wind speeds to the nearest whole number

ignorelacrosseclock.helper: Use computer clock instead of LaCrosse station clock for archive data

extrasensors.helper: Display and log extra sensors, if fitted

nosensorcheck.helper: Make Cumulus MX run even if you do not have the minimum sensors required (temp, press, wind)

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

avgbearingmins.helper: Period of time in minutes to average out wind bearings

avgspeedmins.helper: Period of time in minutes to average out wind speeds

peakgustmins.helper: Period of time in minutes to record the peak gust speed

usecumulusforecast.helper: Use the Zambretti forecast generated by Cumulus

updatehourly.helper: If using the Cumulus forecast, update only once an hour rather than every data update

lowpressureextreme.helper: The low pressure extreme for your location

highpressureextreme.helper: The high pressure extreme for your location

pressureunit.helper: The units that you have used for the pressure extremes

Solar.helper: Settings used for determining hours of sunshine

solarcalc.helper: Select the algorithm to use for solar irradiation calculations

sunthreshold.helper: The percentage of the current theoretical solar value above which the sun should be considered to be shining (default = 75)

solarmin.helper: The minimum solar reading for the sun to be considered to be shining (default = 0)

transfactor.helper: The R-S transmission factor of the solar radiation through the atmosphere (0.70 - 0.91, default 0.80)

ytdamount.helper: Enter a rainfall amount to be added to the total for the year when you started using Cumulus - for the period for which you have no Cumulus data

ytdyear.helper: Enter the year to apply the correct to (normally this year or last year) as a four digit number. Leave as zero to disable

rainseasonstart.helper: Select the month from which the annual total is to be calculated

graphhours.helper: The number of hours shown on the minute-by-minute graphs

graphdays.helper: The number of days shown on the daily graphs

datavisibility.helper: Show or hide data series on the dashboard and web site

helpers: The number of cardinal points to display on the Wind Rose
Set this to 8 for Fine Offset stations
Enabling this option will display Apparent temperature on the default web site
Disabling this option will display Feels Like temperature on the default web site
Enabling this option will display solar data on the default web site
Enabling this option will display UV-I data on the default web site
